title: 18xx Maker
about: This app can take 18xx game definitions written in json, display them, and render them for printing. The original intent of this site was for personal PnP projects, but the purpose has shifted over time to prototyping new games.
piracy: Do not use this app to print games that you don't have a license to print. Please support our 18xx designers, developers, and publishers.

wip.note: Some games are still works in progress. Please submit any bugs found as <github>issues on Github</github>!
wip.tooltip: This game is marked as being a work in progress
wip.description: This game might not be complete or accurate

export.singlePdf: Export this component as a pdf document
export.singlePng: Export this component as a png image

die.title: Die Cutter
die.description: Info about the Ellison die cutter

page.description: This page shows all of the generic tiles that 18xx Maker knows about.

atoms.title: Map Elements
atoms.description: Basic atoms for maps and tiles

page.description: This page shows examples of all items that you can display on either map hexes or tiles. Use these examples to help prototype your game!
Here are all of the SVG logos bundled with 18xx Maker.

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: You can use this app in your browser at it's <public>main website</public> or <app>download it as an app</app> to use some of it's more advanced features. If you are working on prototyping your own game we highly recommend you download the app.

features.title: Features
features.1: Load an 18xx Maker game file and display it.
features.3: Render games with your own design choices with themes and configuration options.
features.4: Quickly design new games making use of our extensive set of elements and logos.

browser.1: Print components directly from your web browser.

app.1: Live reloading of games as you edit definition files.
app.2: Export full games or individual components as PDF documents or PNG images.
app.3: Export games as Board18 game boxes.

donations.title: Donations
donations.description: I've been asked about donation buttons; if you find this software useful to you and would like to donate money towards its development you can do so via <paypal>Paypal</paypal> or <cash>Square Cash</cash>.
